a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: The two Germanies: Planning and capitalism - GDP per capita, 1950 to
GDP per capita is measured in 1990 international dollars, which adjusts for inflation and price differences across countries. Unit 1
'The capitalist revolution’ Section 1.9 'Capitalism, causation and history's hockey stick' in The CORE Team, The Economy.
Data source: The 2015 Total Economy Database
Note: The units of measurement is '1990 international dollar'. The chart uses ratio scale. CC-BY-ND-NC
